At-a-Glance: Make buying easy: neat price list, MOQs, shelf-ready packs, and fast replenishment keep retailers happy.
Why it Matters: Wholesale smooths volume and cash flow.
Objectives: Create a simple wholesale sheet with SKUs and MOQs.
Standardise cases, barcodes, and shelf footprints.
Set reorder lead times and delivery cadence.
What Good Looks Like: One-page trade sheet: prices, margins, MOQs, case sizes.
Cases with outer barcode; BBE/batch visible.
Email order + EDI/portal optional; deliver on agreed day.
Step-by-Step: 1) Finalise SKUs and case counts; print trade sheet.
2) Gather barcodes; add to labels and cases.
3) Pitch: sample + sheet + story; confirm terms.
4) Deliver; follow up with sell-through tips; book replenishment.
Seasonality & Climate: Q4 lifts; pre-build cases; plan gift packs.
Heat-sensitive goods need shaded delivery van times.
Data & Thresholds: Retail margin target (e.g., 40–50%) and your floor.
Lead time promise (e.g., 7 days) and on-time %.
Diagnostics & Decision Tree: Slow sell-through -> Demo day; bundle; recipe card.
Damages -> Better void fill; double-wall outers.
Price pushback -> Offer smaller case or alt SKU.
Tools & Techniques: Trade sheet template, case labels, reorder form.
Route planner and delivery window tracker.
Communications: Ask buyers what sells; adapt SKUs accordingly.
Notes: Keep a rolling ‘sell-through ideas’ doc you can tailor per shop.
